column4: For instance, early on, I get an I/O error that says it cannot write files to a disk
This is doing a clean install with everything being cleared out and going Ubuntu's default.
I don't think it would be the HDD that is broken because the HDD worked mere hours ago.
Is it probable that it is the DVD drive?
The installer encountered an error copying files to the hard disk
Which certainly suggests an HDD problem, but the note says that it could be the DVD drive
And it's hard for me to believe that the HDD would just die all of a sudden.
It was working with Windows 7 just 8 hours ago.
but hdd do just die all of a sudden, thats how they go out
